data: {"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3505710,"name":"Rishab Tirupathi","username":"rishabtirupathi","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/9d8465/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-08T02:59:33.458Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eFor analog and digital inputs, WPILib offers the \u003ccode\u003eAnalogInput\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eDigitalInput\u003c/code\u003e classes, which work spectacularly and are intuitive. However, for the \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003ePWM\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"Pulse Width Modulation\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e ports on the RoboRIO, all of the WPILib documentation only talks about \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003ePWM\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"Pulse Width Modulation\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e encoders, and absolutely nothing else. All \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003ePWM\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"Pulse Width Modulation\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e-related classes, including \u003ccode\u003ePWMJNI\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003ePWMDataJNI\u003c/code\u003e, seem to be encoder-related, since they have “getPosition” and “getSpeed” methods. What I want to do is output a \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003ePWM\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"Pulse Width Modulation\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e signal from my Teensy microcontroller to a \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003ePWM\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"Pulse Width Modulation\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e pin on the RoboRIO, then have the RoboRIO read that \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003ePWM\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"Pulse Width Modulation\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e signal. Is there any way to do this?\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-02-08T03:00:10.133Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":33,"reads":71,"readers_count":70,"score":179.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":485639,"topic_slug":"how-to-create-a-generic-pwm-input-in-wpilib","display_username":"Rishab Tirupathi","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69146,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2024"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-create-a-generic-pwm-input-in-wpilib/485639/1","custom_user_title":"2024","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3505713,"name":"Fletch","username":"Fletch1373","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-08T03:04:52.955Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eThe \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003ePWM\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"Pulse Width Modulation\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e ports are outputs only, so you wouldn’t be able to use it that way.  You can wire it to a digital input and read the signal that way.  Thats how the DutyCycleEncoder class works for absolute encoders.  You can reference the source for that class to help implement what you’re trying to do, but I’m not aware of a native/built-in way to do it.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-02-08T03:04:52.955Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":67,"readers_count":66,"score":23.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":485639,"topic_slug":"how-to-create-a-generic-pwm-input-in-wpilib","display_username":"Fletch","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":9105,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-create-a-generic-pwm-input-in-wpilib/485639/2","custom_user_title":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3505739,"name":"Thad House","username":"Thad_House","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/a4c791/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-08T03:37:32.741Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eYou want to use the DutyCycle class, and then getHighTime.
